category_description: Hydraulic pumps convert mechanical power into hydraulic energy, driving fluid flow and pressure in a system. They enable force transmission to actuators and come in different types, such as gear, vane, and piston pumps.

Hydraulic valves regulate fluid flow, direction, and pressure in a system. They control the movement and functionality of actuators, offering precise force control. Valves include directional, pressure, flow, and proportional types.

Hydraulic elements are components like cylinders, motors, hoses, fittings, and reservoirs that form a complete hydraulic system. They work together to generate, control, and utilize hydraulic power, contributing to system performance.
Hydraulic cartridges are compact valve units inserted into manifold blocks or cavities. They provide a space-saving and efficient solution, containing all necessary valve components in a single unit.
Hydraulic filters remove contaminants from fluid, ensuring system cleanliness and longevity. They prevent damage to components and are installed at various points in the system.
OEM refers to parts manufactured by the original equipment manufacturer. They are designed to meet specific standards, ensuring compatibility, reliability, and optimal performance.
Pistons move within cylinders, converting fluid pressure into linear or rotary motion. They are crucial for generating force, controlling motion, and transmitting power in hydraulic systems.
